activities.loc: Courtroom E, Fourth Floor - South Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben Nunez-Perez

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on February 23, 2023 at 08:45 am.
Status hearing on February 23, 2023 at 08:45 am. / NOTICE ISSUED IN ERROR, HEARING IS A CALENDAR CALL

3:39 PM Defendant Ruben Nunez-Perez appeared by phone.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video on behalf of attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria for Ruben Nunez-Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Remand to branch 2 for scheduling.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.L.T.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No acts or threats of violence. May only have contact through a 3rd party and only to talk about matters regarding their children.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:29 AM Defendant Ruben Nunez-Perez appeared by audio. Sworn Spanish interpreter Jim Larson appeared by video as interpreter for defendant.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.L.T.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No acts or threats of violence. May only have contact through a 3rd party and only to talk about matters regarding their children. Defendant to sign bond at the courthouse by September 2, 2022.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
